msItem.title: Part of the Paradise of Palladius
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ [ܚܝܠܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ] ܐܒܐ ܘܥܘܕܪܢܐ ܕܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܒܪܐ: ܘܣܘܝ̇ܥܐ ܕܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ: ܡ̇ܫܪܝܢܢ ܘܟܬܒܝܢܢ ܡܟ̣ܬܒܢܘܬܐ ܕܦܠܪܝܣ (sic) $ ܥܠ ܡ̈ܠܟܐ ܡܘܬܪ̈ܢܐ ܕܣ̈ܒܐ ܩܕ̈ܝܫܐ: ܥ̇ܡ̈ܠܝ ܒܐܓܘܢܐ ܕܡܝܬܪ̈ܬܐ: ܘܫ̈ܘܐܠܐ ܘܦ̇ܘܢܝ ܦܬܓ̈ܡܐ [ܕܐܚ̈ܐ] ܢܟܦ̈ܐ: ܘܪ̈ܚܡܝ [ܡܝܬܪ]ܘܬܐ
msItem.quote: ܘܟܕ ܚ̣ܙܐ ܣܒܐ ܚܘܫܒܗ ܕܨ̇ܒܐ ܕܢܟ̣ܪܘܟ: ܐܡ̇ܪ ܠܗ
msItem.note: In the same redaction as Add. 14,583, no. 1.
Regarding the quote, The text breaks off with the following words in the fifth chapter ܘܟܕ ܚ̣ܙܐ ܣܒܐ ܚܘܫܒܗ ܕܨ̇ܒܐ ܕܢܟ̣ܪܘܟ: ܐܡ̇ܪ ܠܗ
msItem.author: Palladius
Isaiah of Scete
msItem.title: An extract from Isaiah of Scete on humility
An extract from the sixth chapter of the Paradise of Palladius
msItem.note: in the same redaction as no. 1 (see Add. 14,583, fol. 29 a).
msItem.author: Palladius
https://syriaca.org/person/668
msItem.title: The remainder of the Paradise
msItem.incipit: ܐܫܬ̇ܥܝ ܐܢܫ ܡܢ ܣ̈ܒܐ ܥܠ ܓܢ̇ܢܐ ܚܕ ܕܦܠ̇ܚ̣ ܗܘܐ ܓܢܬܐ.
msItem.note: in the same redaction as no. 1, from the middle of chap. 5 to the end.

msItem.author: Jacob Batnae
msItem.title: Part of a discourse in the metre of Jacob of Batnae, on the Crucifixion of our Lord and the Dispersion of the Apostles to different countries.
The sixth book of the History of the Death of the blessed Virgin Mary
msItem.rubric: ܒܫܡܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܟܐܬܒܝܢܢ ܚܕ ܣܦܪܐ ܡܢ ܬܫܥܝܬܐܗ̇ ܕܝܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ
msItem.note: See above, no. CLVII., Add. 14,484, fol. 18 b.

msItem.author: Ben Sira
msItem.title: An extract from Ecclesiasticus chap. ii. 1—11
An Extract from Wisdom of Jesus the son of Sirach chap. ii. 1—11
Extracts from the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers

msItem.author: Jacob Batnae
msItem.title: A discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the Kingdom of Heaven and on Hell
msItem.rubric: ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܥܠ ܡܠܟܘܬܐ ܘܓܗܢܐ.
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 315, no. 67.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: The commencement of another discourse of Jacob of Batnae
msItem.incipit: ܏ܡܡܠܠܐ ܏ܕܡܪܝ ܏ܝܥܩܘܒ ܏ܡܠܦܢܐ: ܡܢ ܥܠܝ̈ܐ ܘܡܢ ܬܚ̈ܬܝܐ ܕܐܬܩ̣ܢ ܪܡܙܟ. ܟܠ ܡܐ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܘܐܬ݁ܐ ܕܢܗ̣ܘܐ
msItem.note: Incipit is all that remains of the extract

item.p: Paper, about 7 3/8 in. by 5 1/4, consisting of 111 leaves, some of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 57, 65, 82, 91, 92, 102, and 103. The quires are signed with letters from ܐ to ܝܚ, but several are missing and others are imperfect, there being lacunae after foll. 9, 15, 26, 36, 46, 63, 73, 81, 82, 84, 92, and 111. Each page is divided into two columns, as far as fol. 26. The number of lines varies from 17 to 20. This manuscript is written in an inelegant, current hand of the xiith cent.

revisionDesc.change: The Syriac copied from the Word Document needs to be checked for accuracy
